question.body: Dehydration synthesis joining two amino acids results in the formation of:

response.feedback: Correct. Peptide bonds form between the amino and carboxyl groups of different amino acids.
Incorrect. Bond between amino acids after a dehydration synthesis is a form of covalent bond, not a hydrogen bond.
Incorrect. Dehydration synthesis results in a covalent bond, not an ionic bond.
Incorrect. A glycosidic bond occurs between carbohydrates, not amino acids.
Incorrect. Dehydration can be used to describe a form of synthesis, but not a resulting bond.

part.hint: It is a special name given to the covalent bond between amino and carboxyl group.
